intro: Cypselocarpus haloragoides, commonly known as the narrow-leafed haloragoides, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Haloragaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and delicate, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. Its fruits are small, capsule-like structures that release seeds when mature. Cypselocarpus haloragoides is often found in the understory of native forests, contributing to the biodiversity of these ecosystems.
